pros: HHHN is a great place to work in healthcare if you're looking for work-life balance. Depending on the position they offer hybrid/remote schedules. There is room to grow and opportunities for advancement
cons: HHHN is growing which brings some growing pains.

job_title: Assistant Manager in Ind Hillside, NJ
cons: Low pay, leave bonus is poor

review_title: It was good until there was micromanagement involved.
job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Queensbury, NY
pros: Remote work, ok salary, decent training.
cons: Micro management, unclear of what is needed from you.

job_title: Software Developer in South Glens Falls, NY
pros: Amazing, family-oriented, good-hearted people with a passion for their work
cons: Low pay compared to industry standards
Working overtime required ofter in office

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Queensbury, NY
pros: In transition from MD managed health centers to corporate health system management. Salaries went up. Excellent benefits.
cons: Increased pressures to maximize office visit numbers with post work hours charting also increased. Carrot/ stick measures like monetizing incomplete charts $10 each, $400 hold on pay for timesheets not completed on time.

job_title: Financial Manager in Glens Falls, NY
pros: Very friendly people. Good community services
cons: They eliminate positions with no good reason and no help finding a different position.

job_title: Software Developer in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: It is a great company to work for
cons: There are no cons to working here

review_title: Worst Experience With Management I've Ever Had
job_title: Patient Service Assistant in Queensbury, NY
pros: At this point, the only pro is the insurance you can get through them and the fact that the pay is higher than other places around.
cons: I used to love this job and looked forward to going in every day. Now that the network is making tons of changes, things have gotten awful at the health center I work at. The management is absolutely terrible and very disrespectful. They constantly gossip about employees and patients in a negative way for anyone around them to hear. They also encourage us to go to them with issues, but then tell us to cut the attitudes and stop complaining, even though they are constantly complaining about things. And the inappropriate posting on Facebook about their employees is really messed up. For the sake of that center I hope to God those certain people are fired immediately.

review_title: If you're looking to grow and grow old with a company this is the one.
job_title: Certified Professional Coder in Queensbury, NY
pros: Full benefits including medical, dental & vision. Retirement plans. Ability to move up within the network. Employees within the network are always moving around or accepting promotions.
cons: Like any business there is a strong lack of communication which can cause bad moral, mistakes, etc. A lot of times decisions are made that effect a lot/ everyone and no one knows why or what happened because no one was told what was changing or why.

review_title: Excellent Company focused on the Mission
pros:
Committed to providing care to all patients regardless of ability to pay
Exceptional CEO and Leadership that live the values of the company everyday
cons: Hudson Headwaters has grown over the past years which has opened up great growth opportunities for promoting staff; just need to get the word out about the company for those that don't know about it

review_title: good company and growing by the minute!
pros:
approachable management
excellent work/life management
excellent benefits, especially health care
still do Christmas parties and bonuses
cons:
business is outgrowing its "small business" management style; needs more middle management (yes, I said that!) and more fresh, skilled staff to pave the way for the future
no investment in the non-clinical staff's education or career paths

pros: Able to manager yourself and time without people looking over your shoulder.
cons: Overall a good place to be employeed at however with the economy in a down swing people were let go due to downsizing and they were not informed before hand even when asked directly.

pros: Interesting work, always growing, always changing. Have had at least six different jobs in my 25+ years here.
cons: We have some growing pains associated with fast growth and the incredible size of the geographic region we serve.

review_title: Wonderful organization to work for. A not-for-profit network that serves the surrounding communities.
pros: Great people who work hard to help the poor, elderly, uninsured and underinsured with health care.
cons: As with most companies, clearer communication between managment and employees needs to be developed further.

job_title: Patient Services Assistant in Queensbury, NY
pros: Hardworking environment, that show the upmost patient care, and strive to service the community to better service patients, and expand quality patient care
cons: extremely busy environment, must have the ability to multitask, can be overwhelming at time, understaffed

job_title: Finance and Purchasing Coordinator in Queensbury, NY
cons: No formal job training, expectations are that you will come in and perform the job instantaneously with zero mistakes or they will get rid of you immediately, which is what happened to me.

pros: Team of professionals that are a pleasure to work with.
cons: I have not seen anything that I would put here.
